== Main Inclusion Report for libvirt ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libv/libvirt, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of Redhat clustering tools
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=libvirt|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=libvirt|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'normal'.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://libvirt.org|upstream]]</nowiki>.
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/buglist.cgi?component=libvirt&component=libvirt-devel&component=libvirt-python&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=INVESTIGATE&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=REOPENED&bug_status=VERIFIED&short_desc_type=allwordssubstr&short_desc=&long_desc_type=allwordssubstr&long_desc=&Search=Search|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper/cdbs packaging
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** Apart from <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MainInclusionReportXen3%2e0|libxen3.0]]</nowiki>, all in main.
